summary: A once-celebrated kid detective, now 31, continues to solve the same trivial mysteries between hangovers and bouts of self-pity. But a naive client brings him his first adult case -- to find out who brutally murdered her boyfriend.

reviews.content: What a terrific, low key, funny, sad, unexpected delight. Brody and fellow cast are outstanding.

I saw this title on a list of best noir comedies of the 21st century and watched it without knowing anything about it. I really liked it, funny, dark and genuine. One of the better movies I have seen this year for sure!
One of those under the radar gems. Strong performance by Adam Brody. A well-written and often darkly funny script that is never boring. An anti-hero you can't help but root for.

The Kid Detective ist eine kanadische Mystery-Komödie von Evan Morgan. Der trockene Humor der Geschichte ist irgendwie herzzerreißend und faszinierend. Adam Brody liefert in seiner Rolle eine schauspielerische Höchstleistung ab.

Roteiro maravilhoso, bem amarrado, e tem certa profundidade (passando por exemplo a mensagem de que basta crescer p a sociedade te olhar com outros olhos se você não cumpre certas expectativas). Além de discutir assuntos que funcionaram muito bem quando trabalhados no contexto do filme, como vícios e desvios psicológicos (eu diria até freudianos). O timing de humor é simplesmente perfeito, me peguei rindo em vários momentos do filme, que de tão peculiares e despretensiosos, despertam o cômico. Em certos momentos até identifiquei um humor mais "The Office", com cenas desconfortáveis e constrangedoras, e que o filme faz questão de prolongar. A atmosfera de tensão e suspense também foi construída de forma exemplar, e o Plot Twist foi a cereja do bolo dessa grata surpresa. A direção do Evan Morgan é muito competente e de um bom nível técnico, e o Adam Brody desempenha bem seu papel (considero-o um bom ator, muitas vezes subestimado).

I have never been to Canada so this is just speculation or riding the cliché joke about Canadians. "The Kid Detective" might just be the most Canadian movie of all time. In a good way.

The dry humor and low key, deadpan way all the characters seem to have is so great. The plot and the mystery are not too bad either. Unusual. I don't know if it's meant to be kid friendly or that the avoidance of curse words and sexual situations is part of the joke. I'm thinking it's part of the joke because some grizzly stuff is referred to. The way my stage persona Sugar never cussed, except when he did, to great effect. Or was the sweet old southernish man that started slow then described extreme sex in terms of an electromagnetic pulse. Actually I told that joke two ways. 
Anyway I may like this movie for the best reason of all, the humor reminds me of me. lol
Funny, triumphant, and yet heartbreakingly sad in equal measure.

This was a really, really great film - in fact, one of the best i've seen that's been made in the last decade.
In saying that, it's not for everyone - the humour is VERY dry, and it gets damn dark for a brief moment, but i think it's a quality piece of cinema.
Great story, great cast, i can't say enough good things about this.
Love Adam Brody and his dry deliveries and this flick utilized him well.
Loved it. Great film.

Adam Brody shines here in a part that seems tailor-made for him with a script that's full of dry humour, but also has deeper layers that deal with some dark subject matter such as murder, kidnapping and the crippling mental burden of high expectations put on young people. It's a clever blend of charming dark comedy and a whodunit with a serious centre that it expertly dances around before hitting you with the full blast in the finale. The conflicting tones do somewhat diminish each other from having a deeper impact, but it's also what makes ‘The Kid Detective' interesting, enjoyable and entertaining to watch.
Possibly my favourite film of 2020 and a great film in general, well worth a watch
a big surprise - far better than you think it is. i promise you: it's better than you assume.

This movie is amazing. Nearly turned  it off after the first few minutes during the set up. So glad i didn't.
This movie is so clever, deep and funny it's great. It's skirts dark comedy and deep drama in such a great way.
I was thinking about this film a long time afterwards.
Also the lead actor was fantastic,

The story is compelling, the cinematography gently messages the eyeballs, and I enjoyed the honest look at the effects of putting too much pressure on someone while they are just a kid. It's a simple story that never gives away the ending before it's time, perfect to watch with your meal.

I watched this movie without seeing anything but the trailer after hearing about it on the Welcome to The O.C. Bitches podcast. Big fan of Brody and this performance was absolutely spot on. The co-star performance was equally amazing, and the duo led a good mystery with a surprise ending. 

Now the reason for losing a star. I felt the ending lacked closure. I wanted more reactions from the town, and I would have liked to have a scene or 2 more than it had after the case was solved to wrap up the story for me.

Some dude, now 32, has been a detective since he was in his teens. He solved many crimes, getting famous in his small town. Things have changed and so has he. Not solving big cases anymore, living a shabby life with little passion for most things. Then he get's a big murdercase and we watch him solve it. This comedy gave me zero laughs. It's not exciting or funny and it never really shine. A massive letdown, even if I never expected much else than easy entertainment.

3.5 out of 10 peanut bars.

This movie was so wonderful. Adam Brody has really nailed using his eyes to convey a wealth of emotions and really holds your attention throughout the film. The story is unique and the use of color and lighting was gorgeous. Totally recommend.

It mirrored and was a loud echo of the misery which presently exists surrounding paedophilia, child abduction and drugs. If you need a reminder of how deceitful, horrible and cruel the world is, then watch this film. Not one, single, character was happy!

The tone of the first half is one like a Naked Gun movie, stupid situations played dead straight with classic 50s style music in the background.  As the investigation progresses the end packs a properly dramatic punch.
Beautifull in every way, i loved it.
So glad I watched this. Great pacing, made me chuckle and hit the right notes
Entertaining with a shocking ending. Adam Brody's performance is outstanding.

Comedy? What comedy? They are pretending like DNA testing doesn't exist, and that a rudderless, drug-abusing, alcoholic, manchild detective is going to solve complex cases through conjecture, lots of B&E and tainting crime scenes. The whole plot is majorly lame. It's a tribute to creepy pedo losers stuck in their high school days still living in their mom's basement.

Saw this movie thanks to the recommendation of Red Letter Media and was thoroughly surprised. "The Kid Detective" offers a smooth blend of dark comedy, crime, and mystery into a tight script, topped with a strong directorial debut by Evan Morgan. Well-casted, well acted, and filled with neat twists and turns to fancy those in need of a Mystery/Detective flick fix.
My favorite movie of the year.
Smart, well made sleuth film with a sobering look at high expectations dumped on children.
this movie is not remotely interesting nor quirky nor dark and funny as it tries to portray.

The Kid Detective is a little pathetic as an adult, but I never stopped being able to relate to him. I rooted for him. You could see why he felt responsible for the case he never solved and how it haunted him.
It was not an emotional rollercoaster. But I was there along for the ride and I'm glad I took it.
Really enjoyed this film. Very well made, and enjoyed it throughout.

This is the story of a tortured and washed up PI who used to be a big deal as a kid, but now he is a 30-something drunken loser with no prospect. As such, this film has a good premise and an intriguing mystery, but it's somehow a little too timid in the way it unfolds, with a somewhat satisfying resolution. Adam Brody is playing the same character he played in Ready or Not only here he is the protagonist and not a supporting player. It's nice that he is not hired to play the nice guy anymore now that he is in his early 40s. When it comes to a film with a private eye as a protagonist, this was not as snappy as Veronica Mars, or as weird as Under The Silver Lake. It's a middle of the road mystery drama that's perfectly watchable in the comfort of your home. That is what I was expecting, and that's what I got, so no complaint here.

I watched this film without even knowing it existed. Never heard of it before, until a good friend of mine recommended it.

It was a pleasant surprise. A fresh, playful, dark spin of the classic film noir tale, led by a sharp performance by Adam Brody in this offbeat crime story, using deadpan humor to ease one into a complex set of emotions that explode on a bone-crunching hell of an ending.
Loved this! A great, funny, character study and mystery. Perfect length, performances, and tone.

I first want to say that Adam Brody is phenomenal in this movie, I would absolutely watch it just for his performance alone. Now the plot is not something we have not seen before, it has a similar set up to Donal Glovers Mystery team movie. Essentially a kid who is an amazing detective gains acclaim and a massive ego by being able to solve trivial "mysteries" like who stole the fundraiser money box at the school etc. Until something major happens and he losses his drive. He eventually becomes a pathetic adult who is trapped still solving the same trivial mysteries in his 30's until a real case gets dropped at his feet. This film is extremely funny, dark, and subversive all rolled up into one. Deadpan comedy is extremely hard to pull off, recent examples of good deadpan are the show Kidding staring Jim Carrey, but it is not common a movie pulls it off this good like in kid detective. The film sets up so many things and they ALL get paid off by the end which was refreshing. The lighting and camera work were excellent as well, which is shocking considering this is the directors first feature. The only reason it does not achieve my perfect 5/5 is because like I said the original set up is not something that is new or groundbreaking, but it is absolutely worth your time and one of the best noir style films to hit the cinema since Nice Guys.
Wonderful black comedy mystery
Really charming, witty and well thought out. Adam Brody was great in the lead role and I look forward to seeing what he and director Evan Morgan do next.
As dull as its protagonist. Not funny or clever as it wants to be, The revelations are random and facile. Characters are static.

An exceptionally unique, funny and surprisingly unsettling comedy that isn’t afraid to make some interesting statements on maturity, responsibility and the nature of evil. Great, exciting filmmaking with a great cast and a brilliant lead turn from the always underrated Adam Brody.

As a kid Abe Applebaum was great at solving mysteries and whodunnits on TV.   He started solving little mysteries in his town with great success until his friend goes missing and he can be of no help.  As an adult he still has a floundering detective agency with no business, when a teenage girl comes in asking him to solve her boyfriends murder. 
Adam Brody is quietly brilliant in the role of adult Abe.  This is a wildly satisfying movie. It's funny, sad and most importantly very well written and performed.  Very much recommended.
My favourite movie of the year. Wasn't at all what I expected.

The Kid Detective is a clever idea. Considering all the books and TV shows that have been made about young kids acting as detectives, it’s kind of fun to explore what might become of one of those kids when they grow up. In this case it’s a darkly comedic look at a man who never fully matured and failed to move on with his life, because of one particular mystery that he was never able to solve. I was able to connect quite well to the comedic tone of this film. It’s not traditional jokes, but a subtle undertone of dark comedy, and I could see some people watching the movie without even sensing that it is intended to be funny. It plays on a number of the tropes that most of us know from when we were growing up reading/watching things like the Hardy Boys, Scooby-Doo, etc. Perhaps I wouldn’t have as much fun with The Kid Detective if it weren’t for the fact that there was also a solid mystery woven into the whole thing. It would have been easy for them to just play with the concept and then leave it there with a by-the-numbers story. However, I was genuinely puzzled by this film, and had trouble putting the pieces together, even though they do a decent job of slowly revealing clues along the way. It’s a well-written whodunnit with enough twists and turns to keep you guessing. I also appreciate that there are layers to the mystery, and we are never completely sure if this kid was ever a good detective at all. Since the flashbacks are stylized in a way to make them feel like his own personal recollection of how he remembers things, we are left wondering if he was as good as his memories made him out to be. Adam Brody did a solid job in the lead role, and he sold all the emotion of The Kid Detective. There are a number of scenes where there isn’t much going on, but you can sense the importance of those moments based on Brody’s expression (or lack thereof.) Sophie Nélisse is his co-star, but she doesn’t get quite enough to do in the film. I was hoping she would play a more active role in the investigation rather than just tagging along. It is vital that she not be around for some scenes, though, and her somewhat hands-off role as “the client” makes sense because this film is also emulating a classic film noir. All these genres meshed quite well, and made for a movie that I found surprisingly entertaining, and will definitely recommend to others.

What a fantastic concept and a fascinating execution, a character study with intrigue, drama and comedy.

This movies are little gems that give me a big smile to know interesting stories still can be told in movies.

By far one of my favourite movies of the year. Such an interesting story, with an amazing pay off. I'm so glad to see Adam Brody have a starring role, with real character development. Very good direction from a first time film maker.
Just excellent filmmaking and a very unique premise. Dramatic, funny, and everything in between!
If you like good writing and genre fiction, you'll love this.
Really awesome movie! Loved the style. Acting was stellar. The second half was a little slow. But overall, great!
Loved the dark and blant humor of the movie. Adam played the male lead character really well.

The Kid Detective is a surprisingly fantastic dark comedy. Adam Brody is absolutely fantastic and perfectly cast. I was also a big fan of Sophie Nélisse’s supporting performance. The humor here is very dark and deadpan. It worked incredibly well with me. The mystery at the center of it all was also very compelling. A mystery like this lives or dies with its resolution, and thankfully it was very satisfying. The film also works as a character study of Brody’s character, particularly with the final scene. Overall, I loved this way more than I thought I would. Please check this one out, it was seriously great.
I thought this movie was fantastic and Adam Brody was perfection. What a great detective story.
Really good. Thought it was very funny.
Granted I love mysteries, but honestly I thought this was great. Practical, relatable, funny, sad and at times sinister and suspenseful. I mean...
Really enjoyed this film. Good mystery, good acting and laughter when required. Above all you cared about the character which is always an achievement.

Droll, nuanced and original. A kid detective, a Hardy Boy, grows up to be a middle-aged loser coasting on his youthful successes who's long worn out his welcome. Not only does he now hate himself but now his town hates him too. Not fast-paced or obvious, it's a witty exploration of failure in 2020's America. Great performance by Adrian Brody as the clapped-out man-boy and a great cameo by Sarah Sutherland as his emo secretary.

What an underrated piece of 2020.

Adam Brody was great, as were the supporting cast. Despite figuring out the mystery early on, the twist and revelation seconds later after the reveal threw a massive spanner in the works.
Loved it. Had everything you crave for in a non-blockbuster.
What a great movie! I wish they'd make more movies like that nowadays. It was funny and sad at the same time and reminded me of myself.

The Kid Detective (currently VOD) is what happens when you cross the old Encyclopedia Brown books with Chinatown.   A boy detective who gained fame finding missing time capsules and lost cats...lands a big case decades after he blew his first big case.  The film has a laid back pace and a lot of dry humor.   At a certain point the film jumps out of comedy and goes VERY VERY dark.  For some this jump will make them strongly dislike the film, but I think it works.   The cast is great, but the pacing is a little meandering in the middle.  3 stars out of 5.
Brilliant movie! Enjoyed every minute. Interesting twists and turns!
An endearing if rather meandering little whodunnit.
The Kid Detective was average, so-so and a one time watch. Acting was fine! Good detective story. funny in spots until the conclusion. Film deserves an C-

Seemed like the movie tried to be funny at times,  almost Napoleon Dynamitesque, however it fell short. The big plot twist, you would expect to be the highlight of the movie, but still lacked in originality. And then the v ending,  maybe some one else has that figured out, but just left me scratching my head. 2.5 stars
good detective story. funny in spots until the conclusion
A good movie! Certainly surprised at the outcome!
it was ok........not great but it didnt suck
how they made it seem like ordinary life. how he got interested in it at such a young age. than developed a business out of it.
Really enjoyable. probably the best movie ive seen during covid. great twist. fun time. good acting
I don't know how they can call this a comedy.  Strange ending.
Overall it was very entertaining
It was a good movie, very interesting with a good twist at the end.

IN A NUTSHELL:
This quirky dramedy blends dark humor, mystery, sadness, intrigue, and profound insight. It's a detective story layered with a coming-of-age story and a surprise gut punch. The movie is written and directed by Evan Morgan. I'm now a fan and can't wait to see more from him. Its unconventional look at murder and humor reminded me of the movie Knives Out.

TIPS FOR PARENTS:
Talk of a "concubine."
Some profanity
You see a man snort lines of cocaine.
Talk of inappropriate behavior.
You see the naked backside of a man.
You see the front of a naked woman wearing a mask that covers her face.
You see a bloody suicide.
Murder
Lots of alcohol.

THEMES:
Coming-of-age
Earning respect
How it feels when no one takes you seriously.
The theme I thought was the most interesting and compelling was one voiced by Adam Brody's character. He said, "It's difficult to accept who you are in your head and who you really are."
Balance
Everyone has secrets.
Is the truth worth knowing?

THINGS I LIKED:
Adam Brody gives a stellar performance in this role.
I loved Sophie Nelisse in The Book Thief and haven't seen her in anything else since. She was perfect in her role in this movie too.
The subtle humor is hilarious.
Abe Applebaum's terrible receptionist was funny and should be fired.
Even the side characters are interesting.
Several surprising twists.
There is a fascinating juxtaposition of sweet, upbeat music and a terrible crime unfolding right before your eyes.
The ending gives you a chance to exhale and release your own feelings, along with the protagonist. It's powerful.
There is a film noir feel to it but with a more modern spin.
Effective editing.

THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
It starts off quickly, then starts to drag as you try to figure out how things are related.
A lot of people mumble, making it difficult to know what's going on.
The last 20 minutes of the movie are jaw-dropping and take the movie in a direction you don't quite expect, leaving you utterly speechless.

Never really uplifting at all good try tho. Wtf was that ending.

Seeing the Kid Detective was a very disturbing experience. Star Adam Brody has a undercurrent of humor but is facing a career crisis as an adult. Then he gets a murder case and helps a young woman find out what happened to her boyfriend. It smacks of real life investigating instead of the usual polished movies we're used to. Once things draw to a conclusion the movie pays off in spades and reminds us of a lot of real life stories we've found hard to believe.
Never boring.  Well acted. Don't expect to solve the mysteries; instead simply enjoy the ride.
The plot was pretty funny,  the realism of the character's life was quite refreshing. Adam Brody did some good work in this film.
interesting,  nice plot and well played out.   I always wondered what happened to Encyclopedia Brown.
It was entertaining,  Funny. A little off beat. Worth matinee price.
Subtle comedy in a well-orchestrated film to touch on harsh questions. Great movie.
